content:
6 December 1893 | A Lithuanian Jew, Isak Leimann, was born in Vilnius. He emigrated to Norway.

He arrived at Auschwitz with his two children, Bernhard & Dina, on 1 December 1942.

Isak & Dina were murdered in a gas chamber. Bernhard perished in the camp in January 1943.

#Auschwitz #Birkenau #Holocaust #Shoah #history #Jews #histodons #Nazis #Germany #Norway #Lithuania #NeverForget #ww2 #WorldWar2 #Memorial #Remember

account.note:
Former German Nazi concentration & extermination camp Auschwitz. Official account at Kbin. You can also find us on:

FB: http://facebook.com/auschwitzmemorial
IN: http://instagram.com/auschwitzmemorial
TT: http://twitter.com/AuschwitzMuseum

#museum #memorial #NeverForget #NeverAgainIsNow #histodons

Themes: #Auschwitz #Holocaust #WorldWar2 #memory #history

content:
Did you know Monopoly was invented by a woman named Elizabeth Magie in 1903?

Originally ‘The Landlord’s Game,’ it was designed as a protest against the big monopolists of her time like Carnegie & Rockefeller.

But it was Charles Darrow, an unemployed salesman, who eventually sold it to Parker Brothers after playing a version.

Parker Brothers credited Monopoly with saving their company. Magie died in 1948 without recognition. Darrow became very wealthy & his legend lives on. #history #women

account.note: Author. Scientist. Host of PBS Serving Up Science. Sustainability, Climate, Politics & Science Communication at Michigan State.

content:
Rim-Lit Red.

During the winter months in Scotland, when the sun remains low in the sky, it can cast shards of light through a woodland, lighting parts up, leaving the rest in shade.

Here I used such light, and exposed for it (not the overall scene as my eyes were seeing it) to get this effect, showing just the illuminated rim of the squirrel's fur, and nothing much else.

Thanks for all the fantastic comments, likes and boosts on my images. Very humbling. 😊

#RedSquirrel #ScottishWildlife

account.note: Professional wildlife photographer and guide, based on the Isle Of Mull, Scotland.

fields.name: Website
fields.value: https://www.petewalkden.co.uk

media_attachments.description: A photograph of a red squirrel nibbling on a nut in a woodland, in the Scottish Highlands late winter, with just the rim of the subject illuminated by the light, leaving the rest in shadow.

content:
Dear reporters, news people, etc.,

The reason you're not getting any reach on Masto is because you rarely interact. You just come here, post your news article, and don't engage with the community.

You will never get reach if you don't interact with people. This is not Twitter. This is not Facebook. If you want this platform to work for you, you have to become a part of the community, not just shout at us and leave. Forget everything you learned in the walled corporate digital gardens.

content:
Only in America do we call working people ‘essential’ but deny them paid sick leave.

We don’t need to treat essential workers like heroes. We need to treat them like human beings with dignity.

Raise their wages. Give them hazard pay. Guarantee health care and paid sick leave.

content: My 87 year old parents just called me extremely distressed. They told me to remain calm and proceeded to tell me that my son called crying saying he was in jail. He said he'd hit a pregnant woman with his car and needed bail money. An attorney then called with details saying he would need $7,500.00 to be released. It was a SCAM. I'd just talked to my son. They would have paid except for the fact that I have their bank cards. Please be careful out there.

account.note: Interested in politics, race, culture, class and language. Mother of twins. Former Entrepreneur, Editor, Translator, Proofreader, College Advisor for NYC educational nonprofit. Caretaker of elderly parents. Work in College Admissions. Atheist. Cannabis user. Traveler. Lived in Spain for years, miss it. Occasional foul mouth. Avatar is a pic of my great grandmother, background is a blue and an antique white Arabic mosaic roof tile from Andalusia.

content:
At this point it will surprise no one, but I asked #ChatGPT to define bullshit and to cite its sources.

It provided definitions from the Cambridge English Dictionary and the Merriam-Webster Dictionary.

The definitions it provided were entirely reasonable, but they were decidedly not from the sources it claimed.

This highlights the fact that ChatGPT and other LLMs are not knowledge models, they are themselves engines trained to produce convincing bullshit.

Below: ChatGPT, CED, MW.

account.note:
I am a biology professor at the University of Washington. I study how information flows in biology, science, and society.

I wrote a book: *Calling Bullshit*: http://tinyurl.com/fdcuvd7b

I love ravens and crows.

he/him

content: Want to privatise the NHS? Think again!

account.note: Research, insight, and social media enthusiast and expert, looking to connect, share and learn together with others.

media_attachments.description:
Screenshot of social media post by binkybrain:

My wife has cancer, it took 5 months to wipe out 20 years of life savings and that was with insurance. The experience has turned me into a hateful, bitter person. We did everything we were told. We went to college, got degrees, avoided credit card debt, spent wisely, saved a nice chunk of money in savings accounts and retirement accounts and minded our own business.

The USA healthcare system took all of our savings and retirement and forced us to refinance our house so that we lost 15 years of equity. This is a country I'm supposed to be proud of? I hate this system and anyone that defends it.

content:
Did you know you can talk to yourself on Signal?

Years ago, we built Note to Self to hold your to-do-list, let you send photos from your phone to your Signal Desktop app, or note a friend’s recommendation. Use it for whatever it is you want or need to remember.

If you’re sending yourself passwords or copies of important documents, consider turning on disappearing messages, too.

account.note:
Signal is an end-to-end encrypted messaging app. Privacy isn’t an optional mode, it’s just the way that Signal works. Every message, every call, every time.

Signal is independent and not for profit; a different kind of tech from a different kind of organization.

https://signal.org/

content:
I'm hosting a webinar about trust and safety on the fediverse this Thursday, Dec 8th at 12pm Eastern. It's an introduction to the state of content moderation and community safety here.

I hope it will be useful to people at civil society organizations who have perhaps heard about Kbin and the fediverse and would like to know more about where there are gaps in funding and services, and places where orgs could potentially help augment what's already happening.

RSVP: https://meedan.com/event/webinar-trust-and-safety-on-the-fediverse

account.note: I'm the administrator of this server. https://tinysubversions.com is where most of my stuff lives. I make Hometown along with a bunch of other fediverse software (see pinned posts). I'm trying to fix the internet, and some people say I'm at least kind of succeeding. Based in Portland, Oregon, USA. he/him

content: Today’s poem is called ‘A Time for Sharing’.

account.note: Ceci n'est pas un poème. New book: Days Like These (Picador). Represented by Jo Unwin.

fields.name: My books
fields.value: https://uk.bookshop.org/shop/brianbilston

fields.name: Gigs
fields.value: https://brianbilston.com/events/

media_attachments.description:
A Time for Sharing
 
It had been twelve months since
the disappearance of husband, Vince,
clothes found on Beachy Head,
now presumed dead.
 
Her friends wondered how she might cope
but, to her credit, Sue did not mope
for long. In fact, by Christmas,
she no longer seemed listless,
 
but was demonstrating a proclivity
for partying and festivity,
putting a little of the insurance cash
into hosting a big yuletide bash.
 
Afterwards, the neighbours,
thanks to Sue’s all-night labours,
declared the do to be a coup,
the mulled wine divine,
 
and the deep-filled Vince pies,
such a lovely surprise.
 

Brian Bilston
